preqs: 12 credit points at second year level in Art History and Theory, or Theory of Art and Design, or Visual Culture,  or permission from Unit Coordinator

rules.ruleString: Must have passed 2 (I/W) units in {AHT%, CLS2%, TAD2%, VSA2%}
Must have passed 2 (I/W) units in {AHT%, CLS2%, TAD2%, VSA2%}

description: Popular Culture offers a history of popular culture from the late 18th century when the idea first arose through to the present. The course also offers a survey of the most important methodological approaches to popular culture. Topics touched on range from Immanuel Kant's theorisation of the "Fine Arts" to the folk music of Bob Dylan. The course concludes with the speculation that the era of popular culture is now over with the rise of the internet.
faculty: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture
